info.title: Meeting BaaS API
info.summary: API for recording and transcribing video meetings across Zoom, Google Meet, and Microsoft Teams. Features include bot management, calendar integration, and transcription services.

post.description: Have a bot join a meeting, now or in the future. You can provide a `webhook_url` parameter to receive webhook events specific to this bot, overriding your account's default webhook URL. Events include recording completion, failures, and transcription updates.

delete.description: If the bot is in the meeting, invoking this route will cause it to exit the meeting.

parameters.name: include_transcripts
parameters.description: Whether to include transcription data in the response. Defaults to true if not specified.

schema.description: Whether to include transcription data in the response. Defaults to true if not specified.

noone_joined_timeout.description: The timeout in seconds for the bot to wait for participants to join before leaving the meeting, defaults to 600 seconds

waiting_room_timeout.description: The timeout in seconds for the bot to wait in the waiting room before leaving the meeting, defaults to 600 seconds

Bot.description: GetableBot is composed of the QueryableBot and QueryableBotParams structures.

BotData.description: GetableBotData is composed of the GetableBot structure and GetableTranscript structure array.

oneOf.description: No account found associated with your api key.
You have been banned from using this api :( üê∑
The bot could not be found.
There are no longer enough tokens to create a new bot.
An unexpected error has happened : Please write a rapport tu us.

include_transcripts.description: Whether to include transcription data in the response. Defaults to true if not specified.

anyOf.description: The waiting room timeout value you specified is too high.
The no one joined timeout value you specified is too high.
Your own transcription Api Key must be used for transcription parameters feature.

automatic_leave.description: The bot will leave the meeting automatically after the timeout, defaults to 600 seconds.

bot_image.description: The image to use for the bot, must be a URL. Recommended ratio is 16:9.

entry_message.description: There are no entry messages on Microsoft Teams as guests outside of an organization do not have access to the chat.

extra.description: A JSON object that allows you to add custom data to a bot for your convenience, e.g. your end user's ID.

recording_mode.description: The recording mode for the bot, defaults to 'speaker_view'.

speech_to_text.description: The default speech to text provider is Gladia.

streaming.description: WebSocket streams for 16 kHz audio. Input stream receives audio sent to the bot. Output stream receives audio from the bot.

webhook_url.description: A webhook URL to send events to, overrides the webhook URL set in your account settings.

zoom_sdk_id.description: For the Own Zoom Credentials feature, we need your zoom sdk id.

zoom_sdk_pwd.description: For the Own Zoom Credentials feature, we need your zoom sdk pwd.

JoinResponse.description: In case of join route success.

bot_uuid.description: This represents the unique identifier of your bot.

anyOf.description: The bot does not appear to be in the meeting.

LeaveResponseSuccess.description: In case of leave route success.

MeetingDataResponseSuccess.description: In case of meeting data  route success.

duration.description: Duration of the recording in seconds

flac.description: URL to access the recording FLAC file. Will be an empty string if the file doesn't exist in S3.

mp4.description: URL to access the recording MP4 file. Will be an empty string if the file doesn't exist in S3.

oneOf.description: Records the gallery view showing multiple participants
Records only the audio from the meeting
The unrivaled leader in French transcription services.
Not as good as Gladia, but hey ‚Äî we made it ourselves.

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description: Webhooks allow you to receive real-time notifications when specific events occur in the Meeting BaaS system. To use webhooks, set a webhook URL in your account settings or provide it when creating a bot.
